title: Cuban Missile Crisis
introduction: In the shadow of nuclear catastrophe, you stand as the leader of the free world during the Cuban Missile Crisis. Every decision has the weight of millions of lives. Your choices must balance determination with diplomacy to avert an all-out nuclear war.

summary.userTemplate: You chose: {decisionSummary}. That was your path through the Crisis.
summary.historicalOutcome: Historically, President Kennedy imposed a naval blockade in October 1962 and reached a secret deal to remove missiles from Turkey.

decisionPoints.question: Intel confirms Soviet missile deployments in Cuba. How do you respond initially to this existential threat?

options.feedback: Your decisive blockade conveys resolve, yet tensions soar as Soviet forces remain on alert.
Diplomatic outreach softens the immediate threat, but some in the military demand show of strength.

options.text: Prepare a Military Invasion of Cuba
options.feedback: Your aggressive stance might neutralize the danger swiftly, but it drastically raises the possibility of nuclear war.

decisionPoints.question: As diplomatic channels open, Soviet Premier Khrushchev sends mixed signals. What strategy do you adopt in negotiations?

options.text: Make a Public Concession to Ease Tensions
options.feedback: Your public gesture of compromise wins global favor, though some hardliners see it as weakness.

options.text: Leverage a Secret Deal Involving Removals from Turkey
options.feedback: Your covert maneuvers preserve national dignity while quietly defusing the crisis.
Your steadfast stance reassures allies, yet risks locking both sides into an escalatory spiral.

decisionPoints.question: The world teeters on the brink of nuclear war. How will you secure a lasting resolution?

options.feedback: Your measured de-escalation plan reassures both allies and adversaries—a pathway to cautious peace.

options.text: Demand Unconditional Withdrawal of Soviet Missiles
options.feedback: Your firm demand yields a clear ultimatum, though it carries the inherent risk of provoking a showdown.

options.text: Call for a Global Summit to Restore Trust
options.feedback: The global summit creates momentum for peace, even as detailed negotiations remain challenging.
